item.title: Vince Zampella has died following a car crash
item.content:encoded:
Vince Zampella has died in a car crash, NBC Los Angeles is reporting. According to the report, Vince Zampella and another passenger were travelling along the  Southern California’s Angeles Crest Highway in a Ferrari when the car came off the road and hit a concrete barrier, ejecting one of the passengers from the car while the other was trapped in the vehicle which caught fire, dying at the scene. The ejected passenger died of their injuries at the hospital.

Vince Zampella has been a major figure in the games industry and credited as one of the major creators behind Call of Duty having founded Infinity Ward, releasing Call of Duty 2, and the breakout hit of Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare which catapulted the series to being a household name. This was followed by Modern Warfare 2. Vince was fired from Infinity Ward by Activision along with Jason West, going on to form Respawn Entertainment, releasing Titanfall, Titanfall 2, Apex Legends, Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order, and Star Wars Jedi: Survivor. In 2020, Vince was put in charge of DICE Los Angeles and then in 2021 the entire Battlefield series.

Our thoughts are with Vince’s loved ones.

Source: NBC Los Angeles

item.title: Cronos: The New Dawn is getting an easier Temporal Diver Mode difficulty
item.content:encoded:
Bloober Team has announced that Cronos: The New Dawn is going to get a new Temporal Diver Mode, which will allow players to experience the game on an easier difficulty. Not much more detail has been given regarding exactly what this will do in terms of gameplay, with Bloober Team confirming more details will be provided in early 2026. A trailer for the Temporal Diver Mode has been released.

Cronos: The New Dawn’s takes place in a post-apocalyptic rendition of 1980s Poland. This is the home to a survival horror adventure with some hefty helpings of sci-fi and time travel. You’ll play as a time-hopping Traveller, going back through time rifts to try and extract people who didn’t survive the apocalypse. Some of the most notable inspirations include the Dead Space franchise and the movie Twelve Monkeys. The Traveller’s own suit takes its inspiration from older deep sea diving suits, alluding to the theme of diving through time to save people.

Cronos: The New Dawn Review – Such is our calling

In our Cronos: The New Dawn review, Steve said, “Cronos: The New Dawn is a great new survival horror property and I hope we see more of The Traveller’s adventures in future. The clear influences from genre legends are combined with some original touches to make a game that feels familiar but also manages to innovate and surprise players too. The intriguing narrative, the enjoyable progression, and the challenging combat all combine to make an experience that cements Bloober’s place as horror specialists.”

Source: YouTube

item.title: Patapon 1+2 Replay gets Boss Rush Challenge mode as part of update 1.09
item.content:encoded:
Patapon 1+2 Replay has received a brand new mode as part of update 1.09, challenging players to take on the Boss Rush Challenge. To access the Boss Rush Challenge players need to complete the main campaign. The Boss Rush Challenge will vary the number of bosses per stage with higher difficulty, and they will get progressively stronger. HP and army strength will carry over through a stage and when a Patapon falls they will do so without dropping a cap, but all health will be restored once fully completing a stage. Along with the new Boss Rush Challenge, there are some additional fixes too.

Patapon 1+2 Replay 1.09 update patch notes

  • Fixed an issue causing unintended behavior in some text displays on the WORLD MAP in PATAPON and PATAPON 2.
  • Fixed a graphical issue that occurred with some Patapon units in Patapon 2.

Sound Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a bug in Patapon where the “CHAKA” sound would not play when inputting the command for the “Earthquake Miracle.”
  • Fixed a bug where performing specific actions when selecting save data would cause the game to become unable to progress.
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2’s HEAD QUARTERS where performing specific actions would result in unintended unit formations.
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2’s Paragate where performing specific actions would cause the game to become unable to progress.

Other Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a bug where certain key assignments would fail to register correctly in the key configuration settings within the OPTIONS menu.
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2 where some Patapons would not perform the correct animation when inputting the command for the “PON CHAKA Song (Charge).”
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2’s Paragate where camera controls would become disabled while the retreat dialog was displayed.
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2’s Paragate where the “Deploy” action guide would disappear when hovering the cursor over the player’s Hero unit.

Other Adjustments

  • In the OPTIONS menu, the input timing setting values have been updated to add a “+” symbol for the positive values “1” through “5.” A tooltip has also been added to clarify that “Set – to adjust timing judgment toward earlier inputs.”

Source: Steam
